parameters.description: Optional JSON Metadata that can contain action, primaryKeyName, useBatchUpload and maxNumberOfRecords. action: Depicts the nature of bulk upload. It can be 'insert', 'update' or 'upsert'. Eg., {'action':'upsert'}. Note: 'identifierFieldName' field or {'primaryKeyName':'attribute_name'} is mandatory for updating existing objects. Passing {"useBatchUpload": "true"} will use the Hubspot batch API for the upload. When using this endpoint, please keep in mind that it is an upsert and any errors with a single contact in a batch will prevent that entire batch from processing. The maxNumberOfRecords can be used when useBatchUpload is true. It is used to specify the number of records to push in a single upload. This will automatically break the file into smaller chucks to facilitate the upload. The maximum value for this is 100. If not supplied the default value is 100.

value.description: A contact's first name

referer.description: The URL of the webpage that linked to the URL clicked. Whether this is provided, and what its value is, is determined by the recipient's email client.

dropMessage.description: The raw message describing why the email message was dropped. This will usually provide additional details beyond 'dropReason'.

subject.description: The subject or title of the task

type.description: One of NOTE, EMAIL, TASK, MEETING, or CALL, the type of the engagement.

bounced.description: A HubSpot employee explicitly initiated the status change to block messages to the recipient. (Note this usage has been deprecated in favor of dropping messages with a 'dropReason' of BLOCKED_ADDRESS.)

portalSubscriptionStatus.description: The recipient's portal subscription status. (Note that if this is 'UNSUBSCRIBED', the property 'subscriptions' is not necessarily an empty array, nor are all subscriptions contained in it necessarily going to have their statuses set to 'UNSUBSCRIBED'.)

requestedBy.description: The email address of the person who requested the change on behalf of the recipient. If not applicable, this property is omitted.

source.description: The source of the subscription change.

sentBy.description: The EventId which uniquely identifies the email message's SENT event. If not applicable, this property is omitted.

duration.description: If provided and nonzero, the approximate number of milliseconds the user had opened the email

filteredEvent.description: A boolean representing whether the event has been filtered out of reporting based on customer reports settings

portalId.description: The Hub ID the engagement belongs to.

appId.description: An ID referencing the HubSpot Application which sent the email message

browser.description: A JSON object representing the browser which serviced the event. Its comprised of the properties: 'name', 'family', 'producer', 'producer_url', 'type', 'url', 'version'.

id.description: The unique ID for the engagement

smtpId.description: An ID attached to the message by HubSpot.

dropReason.description: The reason why the email message was dropped. See below for the possible values.

appName.description: The name of the HubSpot Application which sent the email message. Note that this is a derived value, and may be modified at any time.

created.description: The timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch) when this event was created.

ipAddress.description: The IP address where the event originated.

causedBy.description: The EventId which uniquely identifies the event which directly caused this event. If not applicable, this property is omitted.

userAgent.description: The user agent responsible for the event, e.g. Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_4) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/28.0.1500.95 Safari/537.36

user.description: The email address of the user who submitted the unbounce request.

url.description: The URL within the message that the recipient clicked.

response.description: The full response from the recipient's email server.

recipient.description: The email address of the recipient of the email message.

cc.description: A list of details for anyone cc'd on the email.

bcc.description: A list of details for anyone bcc'd on the email.

replyTo.description: The 'reply-to' field of the email message

location.description: A JSON object representing the location where the event occurred. Its comprised of the properties: 'city', 'state', 'country'.

emailCampaignId.description: An ID referencing the email campaign which the email message is part of.

category.description: The best-guess of the type of bounce encountered. If an appropriate category could not be determined, this property is omitted. See below for the possible values. Note that this is a derived value, and may be modified at any time to improve the accuracy of classification

status.description: One of NOT_STARTED, COMPLETED, IN_PROGRESS, WAITING, or DEFERRED.The status of the task

obsoletedBy.description: The EventId which uniquely identifies the email message's Obsoleted event. If not applicable, this property is omitted.
